description: From Middle English venereal, venerealle (“of or relating to sexual intercourse”), from Latin venereus, venerius (“of or relating to sexual love”), from Venus (“Roman goddess of love”) (from Proto-Indo-European *wenh₁- (“to love”)) + -eus, -ius (suffix forming adjectives from nouns).

entries.meaning: Of or relating to the genitals or sexual intercourse.
Of a disease: sexually transmitted; of or relating to, or adapted to the cure of, a venereal disease.
(astrology, obsolete) Pertaining to the astrological influence of the planet Venus; lascivious, lustful.
examples: Synonyms: libidinous, (informal) lusty, (obsolete) venereous; see also Thesaurus:randy

entries.meaning: (chemistry, obsolete) Of or relating to copper (formerly called Venus by alchemists).
